column4: I have problems with my wlan-card (a SMC2802W V.1). I can see the card in gutsy but it can't find any accespoints. If I do a "lshw" the status of the card is "NOT READY!". A strange symphtom is that the status-LEDs on the card doesn't flash, not even when I boot. Tried the card in another comp. also running gutsy, and there the LEDs flashed during the boot-sequence... Any ideas?
how do I see if its not?
for that specific card, I don't know. Find out the name of the firmware in question then rund a locate on it
probably, you obviosly can use a hardware that the kernal can't talk to
make sure the prism modules are installed and loaded
No sorry, my deutch-skills are rather crappy. The prism-modules are loaded. But would that really affect the LEDs flashing during bootup?
but its strange that the card works on my other computer when they have the same configuration
same distro and version? exact same card?
yes installed from the same disc :) And yes the same card
because there are two versions. v1 works. v2 is a paperweight

yes I've read that. And its the V.1 I got. But I checked the hardware information now and it seems like the computer for some reason recognizes the card as V.2.. Maybe I screwed it all up trying to get it working... Maybe a reinstall would help..
that would explain it. maybe it also has a slieghtly differant chip
according to what I'v found here (in german) yes
OK, I just reinstall and hope that'll do it.. Thanks for all the help!
No problem. I've still got a netgear here I've been trying to get working
